summary: The Fight for Families Act of 2025 (H.R. 2153) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make the adoption tax credit for special needs children refundable. The bill specifies that a portion of the credit, up to the amount of special needs adoption expenses, is treated as a credit under subpart C. The amendments are effective for tax years beginning after the later of the bill's enactment or December 31, 2025.
